Package org.neo4j.token

Interface TokenCreator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultLabelIdCreator, DefaultPropertyTokenCreator, DefaultRelationshipTypeCreator, IsolatedTransactionTokenCreator, ReadOnlyTokenCreator
    public interface TokenCreator

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int createToken​(String name, boolean internal)
      Create a token by the given name and return the newly allocated id for this token.
      default void createTokens​(String[] names, int[] ids, boolean internal, IntPredicate indexFilter)
      Create the tokens by the given names, and store their ids in the corresponding entry in the ids array, but only if the indexFilter returns true for the given index.

    • Method Detail

      • createToken

        int createToken​(String name,
                boolean internal)
         throws KernelException
        Create a token by the given name and return the newly allocated id for this token.

        It is assumed that the token name is not already being used.

        Parameters:
        name - The token name to allocate.
        internal - true if we want to create an internal (not public) token, otherwise false for public tokens.
        Returns:
        The id of the allocated token name.
        Throws:
        KernelException - If the inner transaction used to allocate the token encountered a problem.

      • createTokens

        default void createTokens​(String[] names,
                          int[] ids,
                          boolean internal,
                          IntPredicate indexFilter)
                   throws KernelException
        Create the tokens by the given names, and store their ids in the corresponding entry in the ids array, but only if the indexFilter returns true for the given index.
        Parameters:
        names - The array of token names we potentially want to create new ids for.
        ids - The array into which we still store the id we create for the various token names.
        internal - true if we want to create internal (not public) tokens, otherwise false for public tokens.
        indexFilter - A filter for the array indexes for which a token needs an id.
        Throws:
        KernelException - If the inner transaction used to allocate the tokens encountered a problem.
